question: Noise power in band. Two-sided PSD N0/2=2×10^{-12} W/Hz, bandpass filter equivalent noise bandwidth B=50 kHz (one-sided around carrier). Compute total noise power passed (assume both sidebands, total bandwidth 2B).
Compute symbol rate from bandwidth. RF bandwidth B=1.2 MHz and roll-off α=0.2 for QPSK. Using B=(1+α)R_s, find R_s.
An (n,k)=(31,26) block code: find number of parity bits and code rate.
If IM3 equals desired at output 35 dBm, what is the input third-order intercept (IIP3) approximately, given 2-tone test at -6 dBm input produced Δ=30 dB between desired (20 dBm) and IM3 (-10 dBm)?
If synchronized to the second path (50 ns) for same delays {0,50,120} ns, find T_m.
Coherent OOK (equal priors) optimum threshold. If correlator output means are 0 and A with equal priors, what is optimal threshold V_T?
AM sideband amplitudes. s(t)=A_c(1+\mu\cos2πf_m t)\cos2πf_c t with A_c=10 V, μ=0.4. Give impulse magnitudes at ±f_c and ±(f_c±f_m) in S(f).
If required received power is -80 dBm and transmitter power is 1 W, what maximum path loss (dB) is allowed?
A transmitter has P_t=10 mW and required received power is 10^{-12} W. Find allowable path loss in dB.
Outage strategy optimization (discrete). Same states as previous. Compare outage capacity for γ_min=3.162 vs γ_min=1 and pick larger. Provide both values.
extract_answer_code: type=numeric, exp_method=extracted_bps/hz, pred_method=raw_number, raw_answer=γ_min=3.162 gives 0.580 bps/Hz; γ_min=1 gives 0.750 bps/Hz (better)

question: Matched filter output peak time. For p(t)=A[U(t)-U(t-T)] passed through its matched filter, at what time does the output reach maximum?

Compute noise spectral density from measured SNR. A coherent DSB-SC link has transmitted signal power S_i=5 kW at demod input, message bandwidth f_m=4 kHz. Output SNR is 500. For coherent DSB-SC, S_o/N_o=2(S_i/N_i). Assume ideal BPF passing both sidebands so N_i=2 P_n f_m with flat two-sided PSD P_n. Find P_n (W/Hz).
Compute required received power for SNR=15 dB in that band. If N=3.75×10^{-5} W, find P_s.
Chip rate is 2 Mcps and m-sequence period is 31 chips. Find period time.
Compute 2ASK coherent BER using P_b=Q(\sqrt{E_b/N0}) at E_b/N0=10.
Coherent BPSK over AWGN. Given E_b/N_0 = 12 dB, estimate BER P_b.
Shannon capacity. AWGN channel B=10 MHz, SNR=8 dB. Compute C (Mbit/s).
Compute group sync length n for false sync ≤ once per day. Bit rate R=50 bit/s, equiprobable bits, no errors allowed (m=0). Use P_f=2^{-n} ≤ 1/(RT).
Compute 8PSK nearest-neighbor union bound. Use p_b≈(2/3)Q(\sqrt{6(E_b/N0)} sin(π/8)). For E_b/N0=10 dB, compute p_b.
For the same amplifier, what is the output power when IM3 equals desired?
Compute required modulation order to fit R_b=240 kbit/s into baseband bandwidth B=120 kHz with α=0.25. Use R_b=2B log2(M)/(1+α). Find minimum power-of-2 M.
Timing error constraint: |ε|/T=0.33/√(10K·E_b/N0). For K=2 and E_b/N0=12 dB, compute |ε|/T.
Given city area 225 km^2 and 150 users per cell, what cell area is needed to support 100,000 users?
Compute center frequency for allocated band 470–476 MHz.
Coherent BPSK over AWGN. Given E_b/N_0 = 2 dB, estimate BER P_b.
Gray-coded QPSK required E_b/N_0. Target BER P_b=2×10^{-6}. Find E_b/N_0 in dB (use Q^{-1}(2e-6)≈4.61).
Two-user uplink: P1=10 mW, P2=5 mW, noise N=1 mW, B=20 MHz. User 1 decoded first. Compute capacity C1.

AM spectrum line magnitudes. s(t)=A_c(1+\mu\cos(2\pi f_m t))\cos(2\pi f_c t) with A_c=4 V, \mu=0.6. Find the magnitudes of the impulses in S(f) at ±f_c and at ±(f_c±f_m) (impulse representation in Hz).
extract_answer_code: type=formula, exp_method=formula, pred_method=formula, raw_answer=|line at ±f_c|=2; |each sideband line|=0.6

question: Coherent BPSK over AWGN. Given E_b/N_0 = 3 dB, estimate BER P_b. Output numeric value.
A 2-user uplink has P1=4 mW, P2=1 mW, N=1 mW, B=5 MHz. If user 1 decoded first, compute C1=B log2(1+P1/(P2+N)).
Matched filter output time for pulse s(t)=A[U(t)-U(t-3T/4)]. Matched filter uses h(t)=s(T-t). At what time does output peak?
For an allocated band 30–50 MHz, select the carrier frequency centered in the band.
(Extra) Coherent 16-QAM union-bound BER. Using p_b≈(3/4)Q(\sqrt{(4/5)E_b/N_0}), compute p_b for E_b/N_0=14 dB.
Uniform quantizer. If Δ=0.5 V and range is 0 to 20 V with endpoints included, find L.
Compute MAP threshold for 2PSK with P1=0.9, P2=0.1, A=0.5, N0=0.2.
Given noise power -121 dBm and required SNR 18 dB, find required received power.
For a bipolar (polar) NRZ system, Pb=Q(\sqrt{2S/N}). If S/N=20 (linear), estimate Pb.
A unipolar NRZ system has S/N=10. Compute Pb=Q(√(S/N)).
OOK coherent BER with matched filter (equal priors). If E_b/N_0=12 (linear) and P_b=Q(\sqrt{E_b/N_0}), compute P_b.
AM synchronous detection gain factor. For modulation index μ=0.6, compute G_AM=μ^2/(2+μ^2) (envelope) and compare to coherent DSB-SC gain 2. Give ratio in dB.
Compute BER for coherent orthogonal BFSK at E_b/N0=12 dB.
64-QAM union-bound BER. Using p_b≈(4/\log2 64)(1-1/\sqrt{64})Q(\sqrt{(3\log2 64/(64-1))E_b/N_0}) (approx). For E_b/N_0=18 dB, estimate p_b (use dominant Q term).
Angle modulation: given s(t)=cos(ω_c t + 40 cos ω_m t). If it is FM with sensitivity K_FM=4 (rad/(V·s)), find modulating signal f(t).
extract_answer_code: type=formula, exp_method=formula, pred_method=formula, raw_answer=f(t)=-10ω_m sin(ω_m t)

question: Two antennas: TX has radiation resistance 60 Ω, RX has radiation resistance 3 Ω. Each has ohmic loss 12 Ω. Find their radiation efficiencies.
For BPSK, if Pb=0.01, estimate required E_b/N0 (dB).
Capacity of a 3.4 kHz telephone channel at output SNR 20 dB. Compute C (kbit/s).

For a unipolar NRZ system, use Pb=Q(\sqrt{S/N}) with received S/N=20 (linear). Estimate Pb.
Two antennas: TX has radiation resistance 60 Ω, RX has radiation resistance 3 Ω. Each has ohmic loss 12 Ω. Find their radiation efficiencies.

question: A 2ASK (coherent) system has symbol rate R_s=2×10^6 baud, received amplitude A=2 mV, and double-sided noise PSD n0=1×10^{-10} W/Hz. Estimate BER using P_b=Q(\sqrt{E_b/N0}) and E_b=A^2/(4R_s), N0=n0/2.
Compute correlation threshold spacing. For exponential PDP with τ_rms=1 μs, find Δf such that |R(Δf)|<0.3 using |R|=1/\sqrt{1+(2πΔf τ_rms)^2}.

A bandpass channel has bandwidth 3000 Hz and uses binary NRZ for 2PSK. Compute spectral efficiency η.
Compute required S/N ratios for bipolar and unipolar NRZ to get BER 10^{-6}. Use Q^{-1}(1e-6)=4.753. Bipolar: Pb=Q(\sqrt{2S/N}); Unipolar: Pb=Q(\sqrt{S/N}).
Coherent BPSK over AWGN. Given E_b/N_0 = 6 dB, estimate the bit error rate P_b. Output numeric value.
